instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.3V3_S5: What is 3V3_S5? 3V3_S5 and PP3V3_S5 are interchangeable, see definition for PP3V3_S5. .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_SLP_SUS_L:
What is PM_SLP_SUS_L? 
The "PM_SLP_SUS_L" signal in a MacBook is related to the power management of the device, specifically concerning the 'suspend to RAM' state or S3 state. It's an active-low signal that, when asserted (low voltage), indicates the system should enter or is in the S3 sleep state. .
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.U5110: What is U5110? This chip is responsible for SMC_RESET_L in many Macbook models..
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_PM_G2_EN: What is SMC_PM_G2_EN? SMC_PM_G2_EN is a signal that comes from the SMC that is a prerequsite for all of the enable signals for the S5 rails to come on, such as P3V3S5_EN. S5 rails will not come on if SMC_PM_G2_EN is not coming..
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V3_SUS: What is PP3V3_SUS? The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
Hi,

Bath submerged macbook air,
Obvious damage to the backlight circuit and both the lcd connector on the board as well as the lcd cable.
Put through crest, replaced dodgy looking bits in the backlight circuit, changed the lcd connector.
New io board and flex.
When I plug it in with only lcd and ssd connected, I get green light but nothing else

Also not sure about the keyboard, I am guessing there a pins I can short to turn the power on, tried a few that are labeled smc on but no difference

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
Test the board alone, only 5 pins DC cable connected.
It should start automatically when charger is connected.


Try first to start in SMC bypass mode.
Post <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
OK, no green light for some reason when I left only the 5pins in.
<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 0v
<SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 0v

I was checking a few other things

g3h is 8.2v

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> lloks a bit dodgy and few smaller bits around it

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
"no green light for some reason"
Of course, no LIO flex connected.
You don't need the light at this moment.

Confirm if you really have 3V at <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>.
Do you get 3V at both pins 5/8 of <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>?

If missing <SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL>, you may need to reball SMC.
Reflow it with good flux first...

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
Thanks [B][URL="https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/member/682-2informaticos"]2informaticos[/URL],[/B] just shows you how little I know

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> 0V unfortunatelly

<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> 0v on both 5 and 8 pin

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> is missing

OK, I will reflow SMC and see if that makes it any better

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
Don't torture SMC yet!!!

"<CHIP>U5110</CHIP> lloks a bit dodgy and few smaller bits around it"
Clean its area, resolder, change corroded components...

"I get green light"
With <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> at 0V???

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
Cheers

I redone the <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and the bits around yesterday
Yes, I still get the green light when the flex cable is connected.
Checked <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> with and without flex cable, still 0v, I checked on 2 points far away from each other

Tried reflowing SMC, 200 Celsius with my quick 861da and mg chemicals flux  but no difference :/

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
Missing <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> blocks the SMC.
Strange to get Magsafe light in this case; maybe fake charger used...

You MUST get steady high level at <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> to continue.
Check resistance to ground there.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> is good.
Remove <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and check voltage level.
Remove <RESISTOR>R7100</RESISTOR> and check again.
Also clean/remove J6100.
Then only SMC remains to change; try reflow it first...

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
Ow yes, the charger is 3rd party :/

<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> resistance to ground goes up and down 300 -400 k?
By accident I discovered that there is continuity between <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>CHGR_RST_L</SIGNAL>, not sure if that supposed to be the case.
I will follow your advice and report back
Fingers crossed

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R5100</RESISTOR> comes up as 96.7k omhs so it seems fine

removed the <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> and I am getting 3.4v <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> - looks like good direction

<SIGNAL>SMC_PM_G2_EN</SIGNAL> 3.4v

the pads for <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, pad 5 3.4v, pad 8 0.42v ( thats without <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> in place)

<SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL> 3.44v

<SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL> 0.03v

<SIGNAL>PM_SLP_SUS_L</SIGNAL> 3.32v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.32v

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> 3.32v

I guess I need a new <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>, right?

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message: Your problem is also going to be the battery after you fix PPBUS so definitely get a known good OEM 85 Watt Magsafe 2

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message: Tried that with a <CHIP>U5110</CHIP> from another board but same results. I cant be sure about that one so I ordered a few ICs.

threads.title: 820 - 00165 A liquid damage, green light but no fan spin no boot
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_REST_L</SIGNAL> goes down when you've soldered other <CHIP>U5110</CHIP>?
Then change <CAPACITOR>C5101</CAPACITOR> and post voltage for pins 6 & 7.
